intro: Claytonia caffra, commonly known as the African spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in early spring, making it a notable addition to rock gardens. Claytonia caffra is also valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
